arm_group.description: On the pain points of muscle, laser was applied (8J/cm ²) with an interval of 48 hours between applications. In the joints with sensitivity, a dose of 4J/cm2 laser was applied with an interval of 48 hours between applications.

On the pain points of muscle, laser was applied (8J/cm ²) with an interval of 48 hours between applications. In the joints with sensitivity, a dose of 4J/cm2 laser was applied with an interval of 48 hours between applications.

brief_summary.textblock:
The study hypothesis was that the red (600nm) and infrared (800nm) laser  therapy have the
      same efficacy in relieving pain and improving the quality of life of TMD patients

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Red and Infrared Lasers in Treatment of Temporomandibular Disorders

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of the present study was to evaluate and compare the efficacy of red (600nm) and
      infrared (800nm) laser therapy in relieving pain and improving the quality of life of TMD
      patients.

intervention.description: On the pain points of muscle, laser was applied (8J/cm ²) with an interval of 48 hours between applications. In the joints with sensitivity, a dose of 4J/cm2 laser was applied with an interval of 48 hours between applications.

On the pain points of muscle, laser was applied (8J/cm ²) with an interval of 48 hours between applications. In the joints with sensitivity, a dose of 4J/cm2 laser was applied with an interval of 48 hours between applications.

clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Red and Infrared Lasers in Treatment of Temporomandibular Disorders - A Double-blind, Randomized, Parallel Clinical Trial

overall_official.affiliation: Federal University of the Valleys of Jequitinhonha and Mucuri

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.measure: pain points of muscle and articulation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
